page.title: 13RELIGION
page.content: There are three churches,one chapel and a meeting house in the area. St James is the Parish Church and the oldest and is situated at the east end of the town. The clergy also serve St Michael's in Broad Campden. About 70 to 100 people attend service on Sunday morning and 30 at Evensong. St Catharine's is R.C. Mass is said twice at the weekend.Total attendance 150-200.Masses are said in the week at St Paul's Convent in Leysbourne. In the centre of Campden lies the Baptist Chapel serving 40 people on Sunday and playing an active role among the children of the parish with clubs and bible classes. In Broad Campden lies one of the oldest Meeting Houses in the country. The 50 Quakers or Friends meet there three times a month and on the other week they hold a discussion at a member's house.
